summary: This is an email chain between federal prosecutors discussing the drafting of a Daubert motion to preclude expert testimony from Dr. Dietz and Dr. Loftus in a case. The correspondence shows internal coordination on legal strategy and document preparation within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the initial email discussing the Daubert motion, working in the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Drafting of Daubert Motion
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney circulates a draft Daubert motion for team comments, noting completion of the section targeting expert Dr. Dietz and ongoing work on sections for experts Dr. Loftus and Rocchio.

events.title: Revision and Submission Planning
events.description: A follow-up email includes a version with a Loftus section incorporated and outlines a plan to have a draft ready for review by superiors ('the chiefs').

keyFacts: Prosecutors were preparing a Daubert motion to exclude the testimony of expert witnesses Dr. Dietz and Dr. Loftus.
The correspondence indicates active case preparation and internal review within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in November 2021.
The motion also involved a section concerning an expert named Rocchio, which was still being written at the time of the email.
